page.title: 18The Sandpits in Creeting
page.content: The sand and gravel pits in Creeting St. Mary are at present disused and the subject of several planning applications. They do provide however a haven for wild life and an increasing number of flowers and trees are becoming established. They were used on a commercial basis for over 50 years from at least 1929 until 1982. Concrete blocks were made on the site, some of which were used to build bungalows in Jacks Green Road in the 1930's. During the war years materials were used from the pits to build runways at R.A.F. Wattisham. The end of the pits was hastened by the A45 Needham Market bypass which was re-routed through the pits in the early 1970's. A deep cutting was made and the material used to build up the new road.
